alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 1:56AM EST until December 26 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IS REPLACED BY A WINTER STORM WARNING WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet across far northern and western portions of the county. Lake effect snows will move back into Chautauqua county tonight and Sunday. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph today. * WHERE...Chautauqua county. Greatest snow amounts will be across far northern and western portions of the county, with only a few inches across southern portions including the city of Jamestown. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times, with heavy snow impacting Interstate 90. Areas of blowing snow will produce near zero visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Widespread accumulating snow will create dangerous travel conditions. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
